column4: is it possible to change where your updates come from? (the repos)
sure, its in System -> Administration -> Synaptic -> Tools -> Repos
that's the easiest way is with the GUI?
ok, you could sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list, ctrl+alt+F2, sign-in, w3m google.com ...
logging in is a good idea before doing anything on your system
I was logged in over ssh
oh, then through a new ssh, but you need to sudo apt-get update after you change the sources.list
eh I was logged in to XFCE instead of Gnome.
sudo synaptic in terminal should pull it up
settings -> repos?
assuming you have the -X (GUI) flag set with your SSH session
yeah, its under Tools -> repos or Settings -> repos
I just clicked "select best server"
I assume that'll be ok?
i usually do that as well, it pings them all to find the best one
yeah, this should fix that problem
there is also an experiemental package that does updates through bittorrent
nothing suitable was found, maybe it's due to the high sat ping?
you might want to check out apt-p2p which does the updates through bittorrent, assuming your isp doesn't throttle speeds
or you could pick a repo nearest to you
i can't use eMule/bitorrent with my HN7000S
you might want to choose an ipv6 if you have that and have high latency; it handles handoffs better
yes, but some a few hours after others
